title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: After a few seconds the mouse stops to work. It's only possible to move the mouse if a mouse key is pressed down (right or left). Restarted a couple of times, error still exists.

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: After a few seconds the mouse stops to work. It's only possible to move the mouse if a mouse key is pressed down (right or left). Works with workaround from https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/204.

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: Works out of the box. Changing key bindings does not work.

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: First mission with no issues on max settings.

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: Performance on par with native Windows. Have not fully tested entire game play-through, but preliminary/introductory cut scene videos & missions have all worked as expected. Graphics and interface bindings settings are responsive and persist. Initial testing was performed with the title running at all maximum graphics settings and dynamic global lighting.
specs: Intel Pentium G4500 dual-core & GeForce GTX 1050Ti

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: Game starts to a stuck, black screen but tabbing out and back in makes it work perfectly.

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
notes: Disable NumLock/CapsLock if you have trouble remapping keys. Occasional graphical glitches, but they may be present on Windows, too.

title: STALKER Shadow of Cheronybl
notes: Seems to run great, except it crashes on save, every time.

Works great with everything on Max.  Only 2 minor problems.  1) Saving causes the game to freeze up (sound stops, mouse stops).  But for some reason alt-tab out and back in and it becomes unstuck and you can start playing again.  2) This is a little annoying because of the first bug.  If you alt-tab out and back sometimes the rain screws up and  random triangles flicker everywhere.
title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl

notes:
Cannot enable vsync on a laptop with Prime(Nvidia+Intel).
Without vsync the FPS grows insanely high making the laptop overheat, waste battery very quickly and make a lot of noise rendering game nearly unplayable despite no other graphical or audio flaws.
Most other games respect the vsync setting.
Changing BLANK_MODE and __GL_SYNC_TO_VBLANK  has no effect.
title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 5500 (Broadwell GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
